item.text: Now Elisha advised the woman whose son he had brought back to life, “You and your family should go and live somewhere else for a while, for the Lord has decreed that a famine will overtake the land for seven years.”

So the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="06965 06213">did</st> as the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">said</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01931" class="">She</st> and her <st data-num="01004" class="">family</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> and <st data-num="01481" class="">lived</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> for <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st>.

<st data-num="01961 07097">After</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">returned</st> from the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of the <st data-num="06430" class="">Philistines</st> and <st data-num="03318" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="06817 0413">ask</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to give</st> her <st data-num="0413" class="">back</st> her <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">and</st> <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>.<n id="1" />

Now the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> was <st data-num="01696" class="">talking</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st>, the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet’s</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st>, and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="05608 04994">Tell</st> me <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="01419" class="">great things</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> has <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st>.”

While <st data-num="01931" class="">Gehazi</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="05608" class="">telling</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">how</st> Elisha<n id="2" /> had <st data-num="02421" class="">brought</st> the <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st> <st data-num="02421" class="">back to life</st>, the <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whose</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> he had <st data-num="02421" class="">brought back to life</st> <st data-num="02009" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="06817 0413">ask</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> her <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="01522" class="">Gehazi</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “My <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>, O <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>, <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> is the very <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st>, and <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> is her <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="02421" class="">brought back to life</st>!”

The king asked the woman about it, and she gave him the details. The king assigned a eunuch to take care of her request and ordered him, “Give her back everything she owns, as well as the amount of crops her field produced from the day she left the land until now.”
Elisha traveled to Damascus while King Ben Hadad of Syria was sick. The king was told, “The prophet has come here.”
So the king told Hazael, “Take a gift and go visit the prophet. Request from him an oracle from the Lord. Ask him, ‘Will I recover from this sickness?’”

So <st data-num="02371" class="">Hazael</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">visit</st> Elisha.<n id="1" /> He <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">along</st> a <st data-num="04503" class="">gift</st>,<n id="2" /> as well as<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0705" class="">40</st> <st data-num="01581" class="">camel</st>-<st data-num="04853" class="">loads</st> of <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02898" class="">fine things</st> of <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st>. When he <st data-num="0935" class="">arrived</st>, he <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> him and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “Your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>,<n id="4" /> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01130" class="">Ben Hadad</st> of <st data-num="0758" class="">Syria</st>, has <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> me <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you with <st data-num="0559" class="">this question</st>,<n id="5" /> ‘Will I <st data-num="02421" class="">recover</st> from <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="02483" class="">sickness</st>?’”
Elisha said to him, “Go and tell him, ‘You will surely recover,’ but the Lord has revealed to me that he will surely die.”

Elisha<n id="1" /> just <st data-num="05975 06440 07760">stared</st> at him <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> Hazael <st data-num="0954" class="">became uncomfortable</st>.<n id="2" /> Then the <st data-num="0376 0430">prophet</st> started <st data-num="01058" class="">crying</st>.

<st data-num="02371" class="">Hazael</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>, “<st data-num="04069" class="">Why</st> are you <st data-num="01058" class="">crying</st>, my <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>?” He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “<st data-num="03588" class="">Because</st> I <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> the <st data-num="0834 07451">trouble</st> you will <st data-num="06213" class="">cause</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>. You will <st data-num="07971" class="">set</st> <st data-num="0784" class="">fire</st> to their <st data-num="04013" class="">fortresses</st>, <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> their <st data-num="0970" class="">young men</st> with the <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st>, <st data-num="07376" class="">smash</st> their <st data-num="05768" class="">children</st> <st data-num="07376" class="">to bits</st>, and <st data-num="01234" class="">rip open</st> their <st data-num="02030" class="">pregnant women</st>.”
Hazael said, “How could your servant, who is as insignificant as a dog, accomplish this great military victory?” Elisha answered, “The Lord has revealed to me that you will be the king of Syria.”

He <st data-num="01980 0854">left</st> <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">went</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>. Ben Hadad<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st> him, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> did <st data-num="0477" class="">Elisha</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">tell</st> you?” Hazael<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “He <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> me you would <st data-num="02421" class="">surely</st> <st data-num="02421" class="">recover</st>.”
The next day Hazael took a piece of cloth, dipped it in water, and spread it over Ben Hadad’s face until he died. Then Hazael replaced him as king.
In the fifth year of the reign of Israel’s King Joram, son of Ahab, Jehoshaphat’s son Jehoram became king over Judah.

He <st data-num="01961" class="">was</st> <st data-num="07970" class="">thirty</st>-<st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he <st data-num="04427" class="">became king</st>, and he <st data-num="04427" class="">reigned</st> for <st data-num="08083" class="">eight</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" />
He followed in the footsteps of the kings of Israel, just as Ahab’s dynasty had done, for he married Ahab’s daughter. He did evil in the sight of the Lord.
But the Lord was unwilling to destroy Judah. He preserved Judah for the sake of his servant David to whom he had promised a perpetual dynasty.
During his reign Edom freed themselves from Judah’s control and set up their own king.

<st data-num="03141" class="">Jehoram</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05674" class="">crossed over</st> to <st data-num="06811" class="">Zair</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st>. The <st data-num="0123" class="">Edomites</st>, who had <st data-num="05437 0413">surrounded</st> him, <st data-num="01961 01931 06965">attacked</st> at <st data-num="03915" class="">night</st> and <st data-num="05221" class="">defeated</st> him and his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st>.<n id="2" /> The Israelite <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> <st data-num="05127" class="">retreated</st> to their <st data-num="0168" class="">homeland</st>.<n id="3" />
So Edom has remained free from Judah’s control to this very day. At that same time Libnah also rebelled.
The rest of the events of Jehoram’s reign, including a record of his accomplishments, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah.
Jehoram passed away and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David. His son Ahaziah replaced him as king.
In the twelfth year of the reign of Israel’s King Joram, son of Ahab, Jehoram’s son Ahaziah became king over Judah.

<st data-num="0274" class="">Ahaziah</st> was <st data-num="06242" class="">twenty</st>-<st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">years</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st> when he <st data-num="04427" class="">became king</st>, and he <st data-num="04427" class="">reigned</st> for <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="08141" class="">year</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="1" /> His <st data-num="08034 0517">mother</st> was <st data-num="06271" class="">Athaliah</st>, the <st data-num="01323" class="">granddaughter</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="06018" class="">Omri</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>.
He followed in the footsteps of Ahab’s dynasty and did evil in the sight of the Lord, as Ahab’s dynasty had done, for he was related to Ahab’s family.
He joined Ahab’s son Joram in a battle against King Hazael of Syria at Ramoth Gilead in which the Syrians defeated Joram.

King Joram returned to Jezreel to recover from the wounds he received from the Syrians in Ramah when he fought against King Hazael of Syria. King Ahaziah son of Jehoram of Judah went down to visit Joram son of Ahab in Jezreel, for he was ill.
